pullRequest.body:
Add `prod_image_of_disjoint` (and the `to_additive` version `sum_image_of_disjoint`) and `sUnion_disjiUnion`

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [6834b8bb49](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15294/commits/6834b8bb49dac9d75ee1dddd9cb294cba4f971ae)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ filter_erase_of_pairwise`
`+ prod_filter_of_pairwiseOne`
`+ prod_image_of_disjoint`
`+ prod_image_of_pairwiseOne`
`+ sUnion_disjiUnion`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

> Is this more general lemma true?
> 
> ```lean
> /-- If the images only overlap where the value is 1, then the function can move inside the binder -/
> lemma prod_image_of_pairwise [PartialOrder α] [OrderBot α] [DecidableEq α]
>     {f : ι → α} {g : α → β} {I : Finset ι}
>     (hf_disj : (I : Set ι).Pairwise fun i j => f i = f j → g (f i) = 1) :
>     ∏ s in I.image f, g s = ∏ i in I, g (f i) := by
> ```
> 
> I think the order is sort of a distraction here. Your lemma then follows as
> 
> ```lean
> by
>   refine prod_image_of_pairwise <| hf_disj.imp fun i j (hdisj : Disjoint _ _) hfij => ?_
>   rw [← hfij, disjoint_self] at hdisj
>   rw [hdisj, hg_bot]
> ```

Having talked with Remy, I also work on this PR now (since I am working on another PR which depends on this one). I have added the more general lemma.

This seems okay to me now.

maintainer merge
Thanks! We can simplify at bit. There's definitely a missing `@[congr]` attribute.

This seems okay to me now.

maintainer merge

Is this more general lemma true?
```lean
/-- If the images only overlap where the value is 1, then the function can move inside the binder -/
lemma prod_image_of_pairwise [PartialOrder α] [OrderBot α] [DecidableEq α]
    {f : ι → α} {g : α → β} {I : Finset ι}
    (hf_disj : (I : Set ι).Pairwise fun i j => f i = f j → g (f i) = 1) :
    ∏ s in I.image f, g s = ∏ i in I, g (f i) := by
```
I think the order is sort of a distraction here. Your lemma then follows as
```lean
by
  refine prod_image_of_pairwise <| hf_disj.imp fun i j (hdisj : Disjoint _ _) hfij => ?_
  rw [← hfij, disjoint_self] at hdisj
  rw [hdisj, hg_bot]
```
`aesop` for the win here

This works if you mark `Finset.filter_congr` with `@[congr]`; can you do that please?
```suggestion
    congr! with j hj
```

Here it's easier to use the `Set.PairwiseDisjoint` API.
```suggestion
    exact ⟨fun h ↦ hf_disj.elim hj hnI (by simpa [h]), by congr!⟩
```
Could you add a docstring to this lemma (and to its additivized version)? I had to read it several times to understand what it means. Thanks!

That's a good point. While I didn't have too much trouble understanding the idea, it *did* take me some time to understand why `PairwiseDisjoint` is needed, so commenting on that would be especially useful (especially since we already have [Finset.prod_map](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Group/Finset.html#Finset.prod_map), where this assumption is not necessary, since `Finset.map` uses an embedding but `Finset.image` doesn't). Note: we also have [Finset.prod_image](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Group/Finset.html#Finset.prod_image), so distinguishing the hypothesis from that one could be valuable too.
`hf_disj` is a stronger assumption than you say here.

I think using the ambient `g` variable (but not also `f`) makes this lemma confusing
```suggestion
    {f : ι → α} {g : α → β} {I : Finset ι} (hf_disj : (I : Set ι).PairwiseDisjoint f) (hg_bot : g ⊥ = 1) :
```
Presumably if you swap the order, the first can be proved in terms of the second?
Actually, I tried this. However, using the second lemma to prove the first breaks the `to_additive` attribute, since `to_additive` does not work for the second lemma.

pullRequest.title: feat: two Finset lemmas
